content:
• Thursday, October 27, 2011
  • MFGLQ

    Another alarming sign of financial distress for MF Global (MF): the firm has reportedly drawn...

    Another alarming sign of financial distress for MF Global (MF): the firm has reportedly drawn down and exhausted all its revolving credit lines over the past few days, according to a Bloomberg report, after stating as early as last Tuesday that it still had around $1.3B remaining. Shares -5% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:06 PM | 6 Comments
  • CLF

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF): Shares pop another 4.8% after hours, adding to an...

    More on Cliffs Natural Resources (NYSE:CLF): Shares pop another 4.8% after hours, adding to an already impressive 11.8% gain duing the regular session, after its Q3 EPS blows away Street estimates. Top line profit soared 98% Y/Y due to higher iron ore pricing and increased sales volumes, while its bottom line benefited from a big boost in its operating margin from 29% to 38.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 6:47 PM
  • EVR

    Boutique i-bank Evercore Partners (EVR +21.3%) took off today after its Q3 report showed it to...

    Boutique i-bank Evercore Partners (EVR +21.3%) took off today after its Q3 report showed it to be faring well in a difficult climate. Revenue of $163.9M (+32% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.46 blew past consensus by $35.2M and $0.12. A 39% Y/Y increase in banking revenue (84% of total) easily offset a 12% decline in investment management revenue.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:19 PM
  • CERN

    More on Cerner (CERN): Q3 beats estimates on a 30% Y/Y jump in profit. Bookings totaled $650M,...

    More on Cerner (NASDAQ:CERN): Q3 beats estimates on a 30% Y/Y jump in profit. Bookings totaled $650M, up 31% Y/Y, while the company's total revenue backlog rose 21%, as health professionals and hospitals increase efforts to convert their records from paper to electronic. Shares +1.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:17 PM | 1 Comment
  • QLIK

    More on Qlik Technologies' (NASDAQ:QLIK) Q3 report: While Q3 results beat estimates, and Q4 EPS...

    More on Qlik Technologies' (NASDAQ:QLIK) Q3 report: While Q3 results beat estimates, and Q4 EPS guidance of $0.24-$0.28 holds up well against a $0.25 consensus, Q4 revenue guidance of $102M-$107M is below a $109.3M consensus. In addition, Qlik's deferred revenue balance fell 4% Q/Q, to $52.6M. QLIK -9.9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:09 PM | 1 Comment
  • RBBN

    Sonus Networks (SONS) drops 4.3% AH after reporting Q3 results. The Q3 numbers aren't too bad -...

    Sonus Networks (SONS) drops 4.3% AH after reporting Q3 results. The Q3 numbers aren't too bad - revenue of $66.4M (+55% Y/Y) beat consensus by $1.5M, and EPS of $0.01 is in-line. However, Sonus is guiding for Q4 revenue of $70M-$74M and EPS of $0.01-$0.03, below Street estimates of $80.1M and $0.04. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • LVS

    More on Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS): Q3 profit jumped 26% on strong revenue growth in Asia,...

    More on Las Vegas Sands (NYSE:LVS): Q3 profit jumped 26% on strong revenue growth in Asia, particularly at the casino operator's Singapore and Macau properties. Margins were also helped by efforts to reduce the company's debt load through the redemption of its preferred A shares, a move that will save more than $76M per year in dividend payments. Shares +3.5% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM
  • BIDU

    More on Baidu's Q3: Advertising customers hit 304K, +12% Y/Y and +2% Q/Q. Revenue per customer...

    More on Baidu's Q3: Advertising customers hit 304K, +12% Y/Y and +2% Q/Q. Revenue per customer +65% Y/Y and +19% Q/Q. Traffic acquisition costs (i.e. payments to partner sites) were 8% of revenue, down from 8.9% in year-ago period. Company expects Q4 revenue of $691M-$711M, well above $647M consensus. BIDU +9% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:48 PM
  • OUTR

    Shares of Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) turn lower in AH trading - after a brief spike higher - stung...

    Shares of Coinstar (NASDAQ:CSTR) turn lower in AH trading - after a brief spike higher - stung in part by an announcement in the company's Q3 report that it's raising prices on standard def DVD rentals to $1.20 from $1.00. Also weighing on shares is late word that a 60-day delay on DVD rentals is being bandied around by Hollywood movie studios, aimed at helping boost their DVD sales and online purchases. Shares now down 11.1%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 3 Comments
  • EA

    More on Electronic Arts (ERTS): FQ2 beat estimates on a 37% Y/Y jump in digital revenue and...

    More on Electronic Arts (ERTS): FQ2 beat estimates on a 37% Y/Y jump in digital revenue and strong sales of FIFA 12, Madden NFL 12 and The Sims Social. Smartphone-related revenue also increased 87% Y/Y, reflecting the company's continued mobile strength on iOS. Additionally, the company says Battlefield 3 pre-sells have exceeded 3M units so far, but aren't reflected in current results. Shares -3% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu.com (NASDAQ:BIDU): Q3 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $655M (+85% Y/Y) beats by...

    Baidu.com (NASDAQ:BIDU): Q3 EPS of $0.86 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $655M (+85% Y/Y) beats by $36M. Shares +10.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • AMD

    More on AMD's Q3: Gross margin of 45% at top of revised guidance range. Computing Solutions...

    More on AMD's Q3: Gross margin of 45% at top of revised guidance range. Computing Solutions revenue (primarily CPUs) up 5% Y/Y, compared with flat Y/Y growth in Q2. Notebook and server CPU sales rose, while desktop sales declined. Graphics chip revenue up 4% Y/Y, much better than Q2's 17% decline. AMD +6.5% AH. (.pdf)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • AMD

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD): Q3 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.69B (+4% Y/Y)...

    Advanced Micro Devices (NASDAQ:AMD): Q3 EPS of $0.15 beats by $0.05. Revenue of $1.69B (+4% Y/Y) beats by $40M. Company expects Q4 revenue to be up 1%-5% Q/Q, compared with consensus for 1% increase. Shares +6.7% AH. (.pdf)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:26 PM
  • PTEN

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +6.3%) reports a mixed Q3, missing on its EPS due to an impairment...

    Patterson-UTI Energy (PTEN +6.3%) reports a mixed Q3, missing on its EPS due to an impairment charge, but meeting on revenue. More importantly, the company says its average number of rigs operating has increased by 14 from July to October, and it expects continued revenue growth in both drilling and pressure pumping in Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • DDD

    3D Systems (DDD -16.8%) is among the day's big losers after reporting Q3 revenue $57.5M (+39%...

    3D Systems (DDD -16.8%) is among the day's big losers after reporting Q3 revenue $57.5M (+39% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.14, missing consensus by $0.3M and $0.02. Rival 3D printer vendor Stratasys (SSYS +3.6%) went in the opposite direction yesterday following its Q3 report.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:56 PM
  • AA

    Mix Europe's pullback from the abyss with pent-up capital pouring into the beaten-down materials...

    Mix Europe's pullback from the abyss with pent-up capital pouring into the beaten-down materials sector, and you get huge spikes in economically sensitive companies. Alcoa (AA +9%) adds $1B in market cap today, as investors pounce on shares that had shed 34% YTD. Other big winners: DOW +8% despite a disappointing Q3 report, FCX +8.7%, DD +5.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:55 PM | 1 Comment
  • GLT

    Specialty paper supplier Glatfelter (GLT +6.5%) pops after saying it plans to expand the...

    Specialty paper supplier Glatfelter (GLT +6.5%) pops after saying it plans to expand the capacity of its composite fibers business unit, which serves the growing global tea and single serve coffee markets.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:51 PM
  • JBHT

    J.B. Hunt (JBHT +4.8%) announces a new repurchasement agreement of $500M on top of the $3M still...

    J.B. Hunt (JBHT +4.8%) announces a new repurchasement agreement of $500M on top of the $3M still existing under an old plan. The company also sets a $0.13/share quarterly dividend. Shares are in-line with other sector stocks today as the Dow Transports stand +4.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • ARMH

    ARM (ARMH +8.8%) announces its next-gen ARMv8 chip architecture will support 64-bit software, a...

    ARM (ARMH +8.8%) announces its next-gen ARMv8 chip architecture will support 64-bit software, a move that opens the door for broader PC and server adoption. AppliedMicro (AMCC +7.2%) is already announcing it will build ARMv8-based server chips, and boasting major performance gains relative to Intel's (NASDAQ:INTC) chips. (yesterday)

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • MANT

    IT and software services firm ManTech International (MANT +5.7%) trades near its highs for the...

    IT and software services firm ManTech International (MANT +5.7%) trades near its highs for the day after it says it will acquire private IT solutions provider Worldwide Information Network Systems for $90M in cash.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:43 PM
  • BAC

    On a day like this, bad news gets ignored: Bank of America (BAC +9.4%) rallies despite Morgan...

    On a day like this, bad news gets ignored: Bank of America (BAC +9.4%) rallies despite Morgan Stanley's downgrade of its shares and a warning that catalysts for stock gains might be as far away as 2013. The move of its $8.5B MBS settlement to federal court heightens concerns that the deal could fall apart. Even with shares super-cheap, Morgan Stanley recommends waiting to buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:36 PM | 4 Comments
  • PEIX

    Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +6.9%) pops after easily beating Q3 estimates late yesterday on record...

    Pacific Ethanol (PEIX +6.9%) pops after easily beating Q3 estimates late yesterday on record sales volume, as the company benefited from three plants that went operational during the period. Net sales hit an all-time high of $271.6M, while operating income jumped over 290% Y/Y on improved commodity margins.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:35 PM
  • OUTR

    Coinstar (CSTR -2.2%) shares take a quick dive on word that some of the largest movie studios...

    Coinstar (CSTR -2.2%) shares take a quick dive on word that some of the largest movie studios are considering placing a 60-day delay on DVD rentals in order to boost sales. The current delay is 28 days. NFLX +2.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 2 Comments
  • ERIC

    It's a good day to own a Euro tech stock, as the Greek debt deal leads to big gains for most...

    It's a good day to own a Euro tech stock, as the Greek debt deal leads to big gains for most firms across the pond. Ericsson (ERIC +9.3%) is among the big winners after ditching its stake in Sony Ericsson (SNE +6.9%), but other names are also shooting higher. NOK +8.1%. STM +6.5%. NXPI +7%. ARMH +9.6%. ALU +6.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:18 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +6.2%) shares rebound, trimming some of their 34% drop during the...

    Green Mountain Coffee (GMCR +6.2%) shares rebound, trimming some of their 34% drop during the past two weeks, and some options traders seem to think the bounceback has legs. Bullish call options, at twice the daily average volume, indicate that traders look for a big upward stock move by the end of tomorrow.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:15 PM
  • AVT

    Avnet (AVT +5.4%) reports an FQ1 largely in line with with Street estimates, but the stock...

    Avnet (AVT +5.4%) reports an FQ1 largely in line with with Street estimates, but the stock trades higher after its CEO comments that the company sees signs of improvement in the relative strength of its computer business and positive rebalancing in the electronics supply chain.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM
  • SPRD

    Chinese wireless chipmaker Spreadtrum (SPRD -1.2%) might be one additional victim of TriQuint's...

    Chinese wireless chipmaker Spreadtrum (SPRD -1.2%) might be one additional victim of TriQuint's (TQNT -25.1%) weak Q3 report (I, II). During its earnings CC, TriQuint mentioned its soft mobile device chip sales were partly due to weak orders from Chinese customers.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • RJETQ

    It's a double-digit gain for Republic Airways (RJET +10.5%) after a Bloomberg report says the...

    It's a double-digit gain for Republic Airways (RJET +10.5%) after a Bloomberg report says the company is studying selling planes and DC landing rights to raise about $113M to help restructure its fledgling Frontier Airlines unit. The company fell $15M short of a cash reserve goal in Q3 and a leaked memo warns, "absent asset sales, we will be even further below that target by the end of the year."
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM
  • AGNC

    After mortgage REIT American Capital (AGNC -3.7%) reported lower-than-expected Q3 earnings due...

    After mortgage REIT American Capital (AGNC -3.7%) reported lower-than-expected Q3 earnings due to margin compression driven by higher prepayment expectations, Evercore and Sandler O’Neill drop 2011 EPS estimates. But most REITs are rising despite plans to bolster federal refi programs for underwater homeowners. ETFs: REM +2.1%, MORT +1.7%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT +21%) rebounds from last week's post-earnings crash on a positive note from...

    Acme Packet (APKT +21%) rebounds from last week's post-earnings crash on a positive note from Deutsche. The firm's checks lead it to believe a major deal which had been pushed out will close in Q4, and that other large deals might also close. Deutsche adds it doesn't see Acme's rivals in the VoIP infrastructure market gaining much ground.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • ABT

    Abbott Labs (ABT +0.7%) spinoff Hospira (HSP +3.9%) gains after Bank of America ups the shares...

    Abbott Labs (ABT +0.7%) spinoff Hospira (HSP +3.9%) gains after Bank of America ups the shares to buy on valuation, saying that most of the bad news surrounding its plant closures has already been priced into the shares, and the company has significant growth potential going forward.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:56 PM
  • VDSI-OLD

    Vasco Data Security (VDSI-OLD +28.9%), a provider of authentication software, skyrockets after...

    Vasco Data Security (VDSI-OLD +28.9%), a provider of authentication software, skyrockets after reporting Q3 revenue of $41.4M (+57% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.15, trouncing Street estimates by $4.2M and $0.09. The company now expects 2011 revenue growth of 45%-55% (40% prior), and an operating margin of 13%-16% (8%-12% prior).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • ODP

    Shares of Office Depot (NYSE:ODP) go on a tear, up 12.2%, helped along in part with an...

    Shares of Office Depot (NYSE:ODP) go on a tear, up 12.2%, helped along in part with an announcement that the office supply seller will enter a deal with Microsoft (MSFT +3.1%) to provide digital print solutions through the Bing business portal. Small business customers using Bing's online service will be able to create advertisements, sales collateral, and presentations that can be printed on demand at a local Office Depot store.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • ITRI

    Itron (ITRI +4.5%) racks up more gains today after posting a mixed Q3 yesterday. The company...

    Itron (ITRI +4.5%) racks up more gains today after posting a mixed Q3 yesterday. The company beat on revenue but missed estimates on a per share basis due to an impairment charge. Separately, shares get an added boost after Jefferies initiates the stock with a Buy, and Credit Suisse starts it with an Outperform. Credit Suisse says the stock has an attractive risk/reward profile and significant upside potential.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • OTEX

    Open Text (OTEX +12%) rallies strongly after reporting FQ1 revenue of $288M (+32.5% Y/Y) and EPS...

    Open Text (OTEX +12%) rallies strongly after reporting FQ1 revenue of $288M (+32.5% Y/Y) and EPS of $1.01, beating consensus by $6.9M and $0.08. License sales, which helps drive the customer support and service sales that make up over 3/4 of Open Text's revenue, grew 52.5% Y/Y. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (BMC -12.4%) continues to plunge, as analysts express disappointment with the...

    BMC Software (BMC -12.4%) continues to plunge, as analysts express disappointment with the company's FQ1 report. JPMorgan (Underweight) thinks BMC's valuation still assumes "overly optimistic growth," while Citi (Neutral) believes it will "take multiple quarters" to fix the sales issues that led to a major drop in bookings. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • DLAKY

    Global airline stocks are higher today on the temporary abatement of Europe's crisis: Ryanair...

    Global airline stocks are higher today on the temporary abatement of Europe's crisis: Ryanair (RYAAT.PK +6.8%), Lufthansa (OTCQX:DLAKY +4.5%), Air France (OTCPK:AFLYY +7.4%), Delta (DAL +1.6%), AMR Corp. (AMR +3%).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:08 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMP

    Ameriprise (AMP +15%) shoots higher after what looks like a Q3 miss becomes in-line once...

    Ameriprise (AMP +15%) shoots higher after what looks like a Q3 miss becomes in-line once writedowns are stripped away. Sterne Agee highlights stock buybacks of $447M as well above estimates, while net outflows from the Columbia fund business weren't as bad as feared. The firm raises EPS forecasts for 2012 and 2013, and the stock price target to $60 from $59.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:04 PM
  • SIRI

    Sirius (SIRI +2.8%) is trading higher today after S&P raises its credit rating a notch...

    Sirius (SIRI +2.8%) is trading higher today after S&P raises its credit rating a notch closer to investment-grade territory, citing the company's declining debt leverage and improved cash flow.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:45 PM | 3 Comments
  • TYL

    Tyler Technologies (TYL +12.8%) pops after posting a $0.03 Q3 earnings beat and raising...

    Tyler Technologies (TYL +12.8%) pops after posting a $0.03 Q3 earnings beat and raising guidance. The company now sees FY11 revenue of $308M-$311M, and EPS falling in a range of $0.78-$0.82.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • TBT

    Already down big on the day, Treasuries extend losses after a weak auction of 7 year notes. The...

    Already down big on the day, Treasuries extend losses after a weak auction of 7 year notes. The 30 year bond yield is up 20 basis points to 3.43%; at 2.36%, the 10 year is back to early August levels. The long-suffering holders of the leveraged short bond ETF catch a break. TBT +6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • HRS

    Harris Corp. (HRS +4.5%) FQ1 earnings fell 26% Y/Y as the military contractor was hurt by higher...

    Harris Corp. (HRS +4.5%) FQ1 earnings fell 26% Y/Y as the military contractor was hurt by higher costs, but the company beat estimates on improved revenue in its nework equipment unit and a sharp increase in orders for its tactical radios.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:25 PM
  • LDK

    The risk trade is on, and that means solar stocks are soaring (KWT +9.2%). Shares could also be...

    The risk trade is on, and that means solar stocks are soaring (KWT +9.2%). Shares could also be getting a lift from the German government's outlining of expected subsidy cuts, which removes some uncertainty about their magnitude. Some of the biggest winners: LDK +22.1%. STP +18.7%. FSLR +14.8%. YGE +15.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • AVD

    American Vanguard (AVD +10.4%) soars after licensing the rights for two patents to help one of...

    American Vanguard (AVD +10.4%) soars after licensing the rights for two patents to help one of its subsidiaries develop products for pre-harvest and post-harvest commercial crop protection. Shares are now trading at a 3-month high following the runup.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:15 PM
  • MFGLQ

    Fitch downgrades MF Global's (MF -14.4%) issuer default rating (IDR) to BB+ (junk) from...

    Fitch downgrades MF Global's (MF -14.4%) issuer default rating (IDR) to BB+ (junk) from BBB. "Volatile capital markets present MF with significant headwinds in executing its strategic transformation from a pure broker to a broker-dealer and, longer term, to a full investment bank without outsized incremental risk."
     
     
     
     
    | 1:11 PM | 4 Comments
  • SIX

    Shares of Six Flags (NYSE:SIX) rock a 6.5% gain after recording a huge earnings beat, landing Q3...

    Shares of Six Flags (NYSE:SIX) rock a 6.5% gain after recording a huge earnings beat, landing Q3 EPS of $3.43 vs. $2.47 consensus. Extensive cost-cutting more than made up for lagging attendance figures - bogged down by adverse weather hitting 35% of the days in the quarter.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:05 PM
  • BC

    Brunswick (BC +4.1%) gains after its Q3 tops estimates on an 8% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net sales...

    Brunswick (BC +4.1%) gains after its Q3 tops estimates on an 8% Y/Y jump in revenue. Net sales were higher across all product categories, particularly in its marine, fitness and bowling & billiards segments. Bottom line margins were also boosted by companywide fixed-cost and debt reductions resulting in the company's lowest debt level in over seven years.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM
  • ATRC

    AtriCure (ATRC +24%) shares soar after yesterday's unanimous vote by an FDA advisory panel that...

    AtriCure (ATRC +24%) shares soar after yesterday's unanimous vote by an FDA advisory panel that the company's Synergy Ablation System was effective in treating persistent atrial fibrillation during open-heart surgery. If approved for a new label, the AtriCure device would be the first surgical ablation treatment for atrial fibrillation. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:22 PM
  • GOLD

    Barrick Gold (ABX +2.3%) trades up after its Q3 easily beat estimates on a 45% jump in Y/Y...

    Barrick Gold (ABX +2.3%) trades up after its Q3 easily beat estimates on a 45% jump in Y/Y profit. Gold production actually fell 6% Y/Y, but average gold prices jumped over 40% during the same period, more than compensating for the lower production levels. For FY12, the company expects cash costs to be up about 10% due to inflation and a change in production mix. Gold production levels in FY12 should be comparable to FY11.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (AKAM +15.4%) is soaring after delivering a Q3 beat and in-line Q4 guidance, and rivals...

    Akamai (AKAM +15.4%) is soaring after delivering a Q3 beat and in-line Q4 guidance, and rivals Level 3 (LVLT +4.5%) and Limelight (LLNW +4.4%) are outperforming in sympathy. However, Collins Stewart is maintaining a cautious stance, noting revenue growth has been decelerating, and competitors are becoming a larger problem. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM
  • UAL

    Shares of UAL slip 1.8% lower after the firm reports a slimmer Q3 profit as fuel expenses and...

    Shares of UAL slip 1.8% lower after the firm reports a slimmer Q3 profit as fuel expenses and integration costs weigh down profits. The carrier clipped about 1% of its capacity in the quarter, while passenger revenue per seat miles clocked a 0.8% loss. The company says it expects a solid trend for demand to continue in Q4.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:30 AM | 1 Comment
  • OXY

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY +7.6%) competes with the likes of Exxon (NYSE:XOM), Conoco Phillips...

    Occidental Petroleum (OXY +7.6%) competes with the likes of Exxon (NYSE:XOM), Conoco Phillips (NYSE:COP) and Chevron (NYSE:CVX), yet it offers one thing its huge rivals don't: growth. Its Q3 easily beat expectations, and Y/Y earnings and revenue growth was 46% and 22.6%, respectively. But shares trade at just 10x 2012 earnings estimates.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM
  • PLXS

    Plexus (PLXS) trades -10% this morning after reporting a largely in-line FQ4, but lowers its...

    Plexus (PLXS) trades -10% this morning after reporting a largely in-line FQ4, but lowers its current quarter and FY12 outlook due to continued market volatility. Separately, Raymond James downgrades the shares to Market Perform on the reduced forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • CHTR

    Time Warner Cable (TWC -8%) gets crushed by its Q3 miss, highlighted by an ad revenue decline...

    Time Warner Cable (TWC -8%) gets crushed by its Q3 miss, highlighted by an ad revenue decline and weak residential sales growth. A 128K decline in video subscribers - nearly as bad as Q2's drop - is raising the specter of cord-cutting once again. Other video providers moving lower: CMCSA -3.1%. CVC -2.9%. CHTR -1.2%. DISH -0.6%. DTV -0.3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:16 AM
  • MFGLQ

    All over the place today, MF Global (MF +1.8%) pops higher on word it hopes to find a buyer for...

    All over the place today, MF Global (MF +1.8%) pops higher on word it hopes to find a buyer for its futures unit within days. It's not quite clear why this should move the shares higher as, presumably, this is the firm's key money-making division.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • DPS-OLD

    Dr Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD -3.1%) adds to yesterday's loss on the back of its Q3 earnings...

    Dr Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD -3.1%) adds to yesterday's loss on the back of its Q3 earnings report, as Morgan Staley cuts the shares to Underweight. The firm says earnings are slowing, and it sees more downside risk to the consensus.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:09 AM
  • JJCTF

    Copper is the greenest of the green in the commodity sector today, higher by $0.18/lb. to $3.67...

    Copper is the greenest of the green in the commodity sector today, higher by $0.18/lb. to $3.67 and bringing its 5 session gain to 22%! So the good doctor was predicting recession last Friday and boom times today? Time to take back that license. JJC +4.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 1 Comment
  • AXTI

    Chipmaker AXT (AXTI -22%) gets hammered after reporting Q3 revenue of $28.3M (+6% Y/Y) and EPS...

    Chipmaker AXT (AXTI -22%) gets hammered after reporting Q3 revenue of $28.3M (+6% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.19; the latter was in-line, but the former missed by $2.1M. More importantly, the company is forecasting Q4 revenue of $20M-$23M and EPS of $0.08-$0.12, far below a consensus of $30M and $0.18.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:03 AM
  • CHU

    China Unicom (CHU -2.5%) trades lower after posting a Q3 net profit of $248M, slightly below...
